name: MannaBay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Mannabay was the first hotel we've been to in South Africa. We had 2 rooms: the black and white room and the explorer room. Both of them were very nice, clean with big bathrooms and great comfort.
reviews.title: Fabulous staff and awesome breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the team at the hotel was very helpful and very nice to us. Breakfast was the best we had in our entire stay!
reviews.title: 4 days in Cape Town to start our trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: High tea was very good too.
reviews.title: boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011
reviews.text: The only negative aspect we found could be the lack of soundproofing in the bedrooms when it comes to hearing other bedroom's doors closing or cars in the street. But that's really incindental and would not stop us from going there again!
reviews.title: Didn't want to leave

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived in Cape Town to visit our daughter who was studying for a semester at UCT. Arrived with little luggage as had luggage stolen from car in Boston (long story..but police found it all !).
reviews.title: Best combination of excellent service and beautiful surroundings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed 6 nights at MannaBay in Cape Town with wife and two teenagers. Absolutely fabulous time in every respect. The management staff, Margaret and Jean Marie, were extremely attentive to our needs helping to arrange tours, make reservations, reserve tee times, purchase tickets to attractions, and give advice on what to do. Have never been taken care of as well anywhere in the world. The hotel offered tea in the afternoon, cocktails in the evening, and the full breakfast in the morning was delicious. Especially thanks to Shadrack and Pierce who made us feel welcome and provided fabulous service. Everyone was so friendly and eager to help. The location of the hotel is perfect, the views of Cape Town from the rooms excellent, and there was ready access to city center and the Waterfront. The beds were very comfortable, the hotel quiet, and the showers were like standing in a warm rain shower. Very safe and secure neighborhood although we never felt threatened anywhere in Cape Town - the comments about crime and safety noted throughout the internet are greatly exaggerated. You just have to be aware and smart about your destinations. The staff were eager to offer advice in this respect as well.
reviews.title: Superb accommodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, this hotel was comfortable and great in everyway. We felt at home throughout our stay. However, what makes this property truely exceptional is the wonderful staff. We felt they were truly invested in making our stay as great as possible, and they succeeded beyond our expectations. You will not find a better experience anywhere.
reviews.title: The perfect place to stay in Cape Town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: Stayed at Manna Bay for two nights on a Cape Town getaway: perfect place to unwind and relax. Impeccable service, spectacular views over the city bowl, a hop and a skip to city centre and waterfront, great lounges for mooching in, beautiful rooms with eclectic and sumptuous decor, and all in all just what the doctor ordered. From taxi and restaurant bookings, scrumptious high tea with bubbles, to late night whisky, we were beautifully looked after. Would highly recommend this to leisure and business visitors alike.
reviews.title: Heaven in the Mother City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am very sadly about to pack my bags and head home down the road (yes! I live just down the road but felt like a million miles away here). But before I did I just wanted to let you know very quickly about my amazing stay- as it proved to be the much needed 'me' time that I needed to clear my head and work on some projects and revitalize and re-energise. MannaBay truly is the most beautiful place. The high tea was fantastic (the sweet jars just cruel though!), ambiance and atmosphere heavenly, the rooms- well I could have just easily stayed in my room the whole time! and the service outstanding- Pierce, Simon and Jean Marie were unbelievable (a special mention to Pierce for looking after myself and my guests so well!).
reviews.title: Impeccable styling and generous service highlight this gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I would highly recommend this to any traveler or just any city dweller needing some TLC and to be treated not only like royalty but almost like family in your own ( exceptionally nice) home
reviews.title: Inner City Decadence!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this is a great find. it's intimate in feeling, esp. because of the charming staff. the location is close to almost everything. the appointments are exceptional with every comfort you can imagine. high tea and breakfast are worth planning for.good views from the terraces. the underbuilding parking is a real plus. highest ranking!
reviews.title: bigger is not better. try a small place with great heart!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for three days and everything was exceptional. Rooms were large, well equipped, great beds, spa bathrooms. Public spaces for the guests were spacious, comfortable. Food (breakfast and high tea) were both terrific. Staff were always close by and eager to assist in booking places to eat, ordering taxis or giving general advice. Butler Shadrack and Manager Jean Marie made the stay very special. Highly recommend.
reviews.title: superb place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at MannaBay for 5 wonderful nights of our honeymoon. The room was beautiful, the service was incredible, and the staff was extremely friendly and eager to help with anything we needed. They treated us like family.
reviews.title: Fantastic start to our honeymoon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was incredible too! My husband and I arrived hungry and tea had already ended, so the chef made us a fresh platter of delicious warm sandwiches! Full beverage service was free and included a great selection of wines from the wine cellar. Breakfast was also included and cooked to order. I am mostly a vegetarian, so Shedrick, the staff member who took breakfast orders (and was studying nutrition), consulted with me about each meal and made special vegetarian versions of the traditional South African breakfast so I wouldn't miss out on the experience.
reviews.title: Offers the very best in boutique hotel experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only downside was that the in-room gas fireplace and heated bathroom floor didn't work consistently, but the staff worked very hard to deal with the problem, and all of the other services and luxuries at the hotel MORE than made up for it. We had a great stay!!
reviews.title: This is beyond fantastic--one of the best we've stayed at...EVER!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Absolutely the most fabulous place to stay! The decor was unique, with every room interesting and different. I travelled with my sister, elderly mom (80 years), and her friend. The staff were so attentive to all of our needs/wants, and yet, they felt like friends! We had great food, a wonderful view, daily nightcaps, and high tea that we "hightailed" it back for every day! MannaBay, you are at the top of our list to visit again!
reviews.title: Queens for 3 days!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first experience of Africa and it couldn't have got off to a better start. Service was all you could ask for, the staff were friendly, welcoming and so efficient. Probably some of the best "sleeps" I have had in my life! The room, The Versailles Suite, was fabulous. The views over the City and back up to Table Mountain were stunning.
reviews.title: Stunning and so welcoming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And then there was the "High Tea", this may have been a British invention but my how the staff of Manna Bay have carried it on.
reviews.title: Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mannabay has quite literally taken spot #1 in our Best Places To Stay list. The staff were fantastic, friendly, interesting and thoughtful. The decoration and amenities left little to be desired. We made the mistake of missing afternoon tea once....Once. You won't regret staying here. In fact, I'm secretly regretting boasting about how wonderful Mannabay is in case it becomes so popular that I won't get a room during our next visit....
reviews.title: A fabulous stay in capetown at Mannabay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Hotel is really great: very supportive and nice team that warmly welcomed us. nevertheless which wish you have, the Manabay Team is happy to assist you.
reviews.title: Such a Jewel in the mother city!

description: You can't get much closer to Table Mountain than this... In the heart of Cape Town, MannaBay has just eight uniquely designed suites that set the bar for contemporary luxury. From this prime setting on the border of the Table Mountain National Park with suites becoming of Persian Princes, Orchid Hunters and Heroic Explorers alike, you can experience the Mother City in sheer comfort and privacy, with a team of friendly staff dedicated to making every guest's experience as special as possible.
